Action: Test Admin Journal Search Interactions
Go to the DOAJ admin journal search at /admin/
Expected Test Results: * All available records are found, and the first page of results is shown

Action: Open and Collapse all the facets on the left
Expected Test Results:
* The facets opens and closes as expected
* Each facet contains a maximum of 10 values relevant to that field

Action: Open one of the facets of your choice
Select one of the values for that facet
Expected Test Results:
* All the results for the selected constraints are found, and the first page is shown
* The filter applied is shown in the facets on the left and above the search results

Action: Click the value off in the facet to the left so all values are shown again
Expected Test Results: * The search results reset

Action: Go through each sort option in the sort option for one facet
Expected Test Results: * The order that the filters are listed in changes accordingly

Action: In each case, click the "sort by" button to reverse the direction of sort
Expected Test Results: * The order that the filters are listed in changes accordingly

Action: Go through each SORT BY option at the top of the search results, choosing from Relevance, Title, Last updated, Date added  and remembering to change the order from Ascending to Descending
Expected Test Results: * The current search results change with each selection and are then ordered correctly according to the selected sort field and the selected sort direction

Action: Enter a search term in the search box
Expected Test Results:
* All the results for the selected constraints are found, and the first page is shown
* Your search text remains in the search box
* You can click into the search box, your search terms remains and you can modify it

Action: Go through each field constraint under the "search all" pull-down.  You may change your search text if no results are found, to demonstrate that each field works correctly
Expected Test Results:
* If there are search results, the first page is displayed
* If there are no search results, suitable "No results to display" text is displayed

Action: Change the number of results on one page using the results per page pulldown
Expected Test Results: * The size of the page of results displays increases appropriately

Action: Scroll to the bottom
Expected Test Results: * The page size displayed at the end of the search results matches.

Action: Click the "Next" button to go to the next page of results
Expected Test Results:
* The next page of results is displayed
* The "First" and "Prev" buttons are activated

Action: Scroll to the bottom of the page. Click Next again.
Expected Test Results: * The page automatically scrolls to the top of the next page

Action: Click "Next" again
Click "Prev"
Expected Test Results: * You are navigated one page forward and then one page back in the results

Action: Click "First"
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the first page of the results

Action: Test Admin Journal Search Display
Click the black X button to clear all filters
Expected Test Results: * The interface returns to the initial state as per 1.1.1

Action: Go to the DOAJ admin journal search at /admin/
Open the In DOAJ facet, and select "False"
Expected Test Results:
* None of the journal titles in the search results are links
* "In DOAJ: No" metadata is present

Action: Clear the "In DOAJ?" filter
Expected Test Results: * All the journal titles in the search results are links

Action: Select "True" from that facet
Expected Test Results: * "In DOAJ: Yes" metadata is present

Action: Click on the journal title
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the DOAJ ToC page for this journal

Action: Click back (as many times as required) in your browser window to go back to the search results
Click on the "Home page" URL for a journal result
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the Journal's home page

Action: Click back in your browser to go back to the search results
Click on the "Owner" of a journal result
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the user account page for the journal owner

Action: Click back in your browser to go back to the search results
Open the Journal License facet
Select one of the CC licences from this facet
Expected Test Results: * All the journal results show the relevant CC icon under the metadata field "License"

Action: Clear the "Journal License" filter
Open the "Publication Charges" filter
Select "Yes" from this facet
Expected Test Results: * All the journal results show that the journals have publication charges, and provide a link to the Journal page

Action: Clear all the search filters with the Red X in the search bar
Find a journal in the search results which has a "Related Record"
Click on the "Related Records" link
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the application search results, and a single search result is present, showing the applicaiton which produced that journal

Action: Click back in your browser window to return to the journal search
Look at the bottom of each journal record
Expected Test Results:
* You have an option to make a preceeding or succeeding continuation
* You have an option to Edit this journal

Action: Click "Make a preceeding continuation"
Expected Test Results: * A new browser window opens containing the continuations form '[Journal title] continues...'

Action: Close the new browser window
Click "Make a succeeding continuation"
Expected Test Results: * A new browser window opens containing the continuations form '[Journal title] is continued by...'

Action: Close the new browser window
Click "Edit this journal"
Expected Test Results: * A new browser window opens containing the edit form for the journal

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
